page.title: 09Farming in Chelmsley Wood
page.content: Farm land has been lost due to the growth of Chelmsley Wood, the establishments of trading estates, and the creation of good roads and motorways.Typical of the farms in this area is Fifields, run as a dairy farm with a little cultivation of grain, turnips and fodder. Evidence in the changing pattern of farming is illustrated by the introduction of new crops such as seed rape which is highly profitable. Land in the south east is mainly green belt. In the future this land use may change as high tech industry is to be introducted. Sites chosen for this include Fifields farm and Birchcroft farm and the area around the N.E.C. These prepared plans are being opposed by Solihull Council and the Ministry of Agriculture.(Who want the area to remain as green belt).
